Posts.Title: had breast surgery and doctor... cupid104 cupid104

Posts.Content: cupid104 wrote: hello i'm new here. i took sono 6 months ago and results came out neg mass or cyst. my gyn told me to see specialist. i went to see specialist last month and dr said i have papilloma. i asked if dont i have to take sono or other test to locate and see how big papilloma was. dr said papilloma are too small. so i went to 2 different doctor to get 2nd opinion. they both said she's a good doctor. so i believed and had surgery last week. i went to doctor today for my biopsy results. Doctor said i have no papilloma and everything are fine. i asked why i had blood discharge. doctor said it might be scar tissue on duct....  doctor sounded like she believed i had papilloma .. i wont be able to breast feed. i know i have left breast but i could have saved and not have surgery.. im so lost. i dont even know what to say or think Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2009 09:43PM - edited Oct 27, 2009 09:48PM by cupid104 Hi karinda1 surgery takes about 40 mins.you wont feel anything after the surgery..they gave me pain killer but i didn't need any..(thats just me tho..) u will feel sore like when u have period. u will have sharp pain but not bad... maybe itchy after few days. i went back to work 3 days after surgery.   yes i have scare and dent but its getting better less noticable now.  i was told that i had papilloma and she said its b9 and not to worry but it wasnt papilloma (path report). its a very long story that i dont even want to talk about.. but i'm happy it wasnt cancer.. im trying to think positive. i wont be able to breast feed with my left breast..all my milk ducts been removed.
